001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005/**
006 * Interface for mathematical interpolation functions.
007 *
008 * <p>
009 * Provides interpolation capabilities with numerical differentiation support
010 * for use in mathematical modeling and curve fitting operations.
011 */
012public interface Interpolator extends Serializable {
013
014        /** Increment used for numerical differentiation */
015        double DX = 0.00001;
016
017        /**
018         * Validates the input arrays for interpolation.
019         *
020         * @param x the array of x values
021         * @param y the array of y values
022         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input arrays are invalid
023         */
024        static void checkInputs(double[] x, double[] y) {
025                if (x.length != y.length) {
026                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
027                                        "x and y arrays must have the same length"
028                        );
029                }
030                if (x.length < 2) {
031                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
032                                        "x and y arrays must have at least 2 elements"
033                        );
034                }
035                if (java.util.Arrays.stream(x)
036                                .anyMatch(v -> Double.isNaN(v) || Double.isInfinite(v))
037                                || java.util.Arrays.stream(y)
038                                                .anyMatch(v -> Double.isNaN(v) || Double.isInfinite(v))) {
039                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
040                                        "x and y arrays must not contain NaN or infinite values"
041                        );
042                }
043                for (var i = 0; i < x.length - 1; i++) {
044                        if (x[i] >= x[i + 1]) {
045                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
046                                                "x array must be strictly increasing"
047                                );
048                        }
049                }
050        }
051
052        /**
053         * Clamps a value between specified lower and upper bounds.
054         *
055         * @param low  the lower bound
056         * @param x    the value to clamp
057         * @param high the upper bound
058         * @return the clamped value between low and high
059         */
060        static double squish(double low, double x, double high) {
061                return (Math.min(Math.max(x, low), high));
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Computes the numerical derivative at the given point.
066         *
067         * @param x the point at which to compute the derivative
068         * @return the numerical derivative using central difference method
069         */
070        default double differential(double x) {
071                var dy = (this.interpolate(x + DX) - this.interpolate(x - DX))
072                                / (2 * DX);
073                return dy;
074        }
075
076        /**
077         * Interpolates the function at the given point.
078         *
079         * @param x the interpolation point
080         * @return the interpolated value
081         */
082        double interpolate(double x);
083
084}
